intro: Oxysepala shepherdii, commonly known as the Shepherds' oxysepala, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States, particularly in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers in composite flower heads. Its root system is fibrous and adapted to survive in dry conditions. Oxysepala shepherdii is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
